lines.content: * Mobi is a task management ChatBot application that allows users to add, remove
* and manage their tasks through a text-based interface.
* Attempts to load tasks from file path.
* If loading fails, initializes empty task list.
* @param filePath the path to the file where tasks are stored
* Starts the main loop of the application, reading
* user inputs, executing them and showing output to user.
* When application runs, creates Mobi instance with
* specified file path and runs it.
* Subclasses should implement their own methods of
void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage store) throws MobiException;

* DateParser is a utility class that provides a flexible DateTimeFormatter
* used in the Mobi ChatBot application to parse dates in certain formats.
/** Formatter that supports multiple date/time patterns. */
* Parses a date/time string into a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
* If the time is not provided, HHmm defaults to 0000
* @param input the date/time string to parse
* @return a {@link LocalDateTime} representing the parsed date and time
* @throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException if the input is invalid

* creating a corresponding {@link Command} object to return to the Mobi Chatbot.
* Throws a {@link MobiException} if the input is invalid or incomplete.
* Parses raw user input string and returns the corresponding {@link Command}.
* Splits input by whitespace into command and arguments. Throws {@link MobiException}
* if the command and arguments are invalid or if they are missing.
* @param input the raw user input string
* @return a {@link Command} object corresponding to the user input
* @throws MobiException if the input is invalid or missing required arguments
